CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1964, pg. 3, reads: "NEW WARD CHAIRMAN - The above picture was taken on Jan. 9, 1948, shortly after "Pappy" was elected the first Negro Democratic chairman of the Fifth Ward. Harry B. Fitzgerald, then alderman, is shown offering congratulations as Reese Williamson, Matthew Anderson, the ward secretary Fannie Steath, Madelyn Parker, Sam Scott and Marjorie Tyler share the joy. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Robert E. "Pappy" Williams and Harry B. Fitzgerald shaking hands, after William's election to Fifth ward chairman, surrounded by other men and women, including left to right, possibly Reese Williamson, Matthew Anderson, Williams, Fannie Steath wearing galoshes, Madelyn Parker, Alberta Williams wearing hat with feathers, Fitzgerald, possibly Sam Scott, and Marjorie Tyler
